author: sky.cactus
content: I have previously argued that 1559 won't lower gas prices.  However, I am starting to think it actually might in some situations.  The speed at which the base fee adjusts when there are underfilled blocks is pretty quick, but with the current gas estimation strategies out there it is easy to get into a situation where everyone is bidding high even though there is room for everyone in the block, just because in the recent past (earlier that day) the blocks were overfull.

author: sky.cactus
content: Over the last 200 blocks the gas price range is ~20-75, and I suspect most of the higher priced transactions are priced that way because gas estimators are recommending that price to people.

author: sky.cactus
content: Basically, bidding is hard and removing the bidding process means users won't unnecessarily over-pay.

author: minaminao
content: Hi, what is the `tx.gas` in EIP-1559?

author: sky.cactus
content: <@!370136219927052298> The gas allocated to the transaction.

author: sky.cactus
content: It is one of the fields on the RLP encoding of the transaction.

author: sky.cactus
content: Second item in the RLP encoded transaction is `tx.gas`.

author: sky.cactus
content: Yeah.  I prefer `gasLimit` because it makes it a bit more clear when talking about `gasPrice` vs `gasLimit`.

author: sky.cactus
content: We should probably be consistent within that EIP.  Someone should submit a PR to change `tx.gas` to `tx.gasLimit` for consistency.
